Posts.Content: Everett78 wrote: In Dec I had a BMX.  The nodes were clear, but later 1 of the 2 nodes came back with ITC's in one node (not micro mets) and I am still considered node negative.  My onco is agressive and decided to chemo was best.  I had my 3rd of 4 T/C treatments yesterday and he told me he wants me to have surgery after chemo to remove more nodes "just in case."    The same day I had my consult with the raditation onco (my margins were clear, again the radiation is just to be safe)   Anyway, he disagrees with having more nodes removed after chemo.   He believes it is highly unlikely the other nodes are involved and since I'll be done with Chemo and having radiation that the surgery is not needed.  I was also highly er+/pr+ so I will be on tamoxofen. I'm confused!  Has anyone been though this.  Advice? Deb IDC 1.2 cm stage 1, grade 2, 0/2 nodes er+/pr+ her2-  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Lymph Node removal AFTER chemo Everett78 GryffinSong

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2010 07:03PM Everett78 wrote: Ok, I had a meeting with my surgeron today to go over the path report.  I had a bilateral Mast. with TE 3 1/2 weeks ago.  I had two separate lumps (different & not related)  .7 mm, idc stage 1, grade II 1.4 cm, Mucinous, Stage 1, grade II All margins were clear and everything looked "great" I'm node negative (3 nodes removed, 1 did show isolated tumor celss, but NOT mets and so little i'm still node negative)  I'm er+/pr+ and Her2 neg  He says everything is good news, I will need tamoxifin or amidex, but I'm in the gray area for chemo.  If it were his wife he'd do chemo and have the lowest risk possible.  I'm seeing an oncologist Wednesday.   Is there a typical chemo type/length for stage one idc?  Anyone in a similar situation?

Posts.Title: CALLING ALL STAGE I SISTERS sheila888 MCBaker

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2010 07:55AM Everett78 wrote: I agree!  You questions are not stupid at all.   I asked all kinds of questions about the pect muscles too.  I did Taekwondo 4 days a week and have a son with CP that I lift all the time, I was afraid that my pects might be too tight.  I did fine, they were even able to add 100cc at surgery time. (my BMX was 12/17/09) I used this cami and loved it!  www.thepinkbra.com/amoena2105.html   I just threw a button up shirt over it for trips to the dr. I think the hardest part of the BMX recovery is getting a good nights sleep.  The TE's & drains make it hard.  So, nap when you can and take it easy.  Walking is good for you and will help mentally too! Deb
Posts.Title: I got my date...May 17 bmx..and now I have weird questions... 1WonderWoman Sherry9316

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2010 12:20AM Everett78 wrote: I'm getting ready for my 4th TC next week.  I get the standard 1 every 3 weeks.   I've tolerated it pretty well, I feel pretty good 1 week after treatment, except for heartburn & tummy cramps.  Of course, I can't taste anything! If you went weekly would you be on steriods fulltime?  I take steriods the day before, day of chemo and two days after.  Fulltime steriods would drive me nuts. If they'd offered me the option of every two weeks I would have taken it, but weekly would be hard. Does your dr think the weekly dose would be more effective? There is a "topic" for those of us TC, you should look it up.  The ladies have been great about sharing their experiences and side effects.
